name: YWPD-TC-913 - Verify that user is able to successfully generate the Assembly Map Test Program Level Policy -- @1.1

steps.name: Given The user successfully opened the yieldWerx web application and login
When Open Assembly Map Policies module
And Click on the Create Assembly Map Policy button
And Provide the assembly map policy "Test Program Level Policy" in the "General" tab
And Navigate into the "Parameter" tab and select the "Small Data Set", and "WEB SMALL DATA SET"
And After selecting facility data will be populated automatically for work center, device and test program
And Choose wafer from "Pre PAT Final Probe (Probe Pass 1 OR M)" dropdown available on the parameters tab
And Navigate into the "Generation" tab
And Choose the AMG format from "ASCII TMA" dropdown
And Navigate into the "Output" tab
And Enter the folder path into the "D:\AMG" Input field
And Select the options from "Rename Old and Create New"
And Enter the "@FacilityID, @Date, @Time" into the input field, Enter @ in the input field, options list will be visible select option from the list
And Choose the "Local/Network Drive" from the available Options
And Click on the "Add Path" button
And Check on the "Output Destination Of Assembly Map File" that path has been added
And Enable the check box of "Enable"
And Click on the save button available at the end
And Saved AMG policy is shown in the AMG Policies grid section
And Enable your saved policy
Then Policy will be activated successfully

parameters.name: Generate Assembly Map From
parameters.value: Pre PAT Final Probe (Probe Pass 1 OR M)

parameters.name: Conversion of Assembly Map File to Format
If Previous Assembly Map File Exists

fullName: AMG Policies: YWPD-TC-913 - Verify that user is able to successfully generate the Assembly Map Test Program Level Policy
